ngoList.ngoName: KHAMIR Kachchh Heritage Art Music Information and Resources
ngoList.address: KHAMIR, Behind BMCB Social City, Kukma road to Lakhond crossroads, P. O. Kukma, Ta. Bhuj, Dist. Kachchh 370105 Gujarat
ngoList.title: KHAMIR Kachchh Heritage Art Music Information and Resources
ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: About KHAMIR Khamir is a non-profit working with traditional artisan communities of Kachchh since its inception post-earthquake 2001. The organization was established by Nehru Foundation for Development (NFD) and Kutch Nav Nirman Abhiyan (KNNA) with a goal to revive and reposition the traditional crafts and creative industries through empowerment of tradition artisans of Kutch. 1. Sectoral interventions 1.1 GI for Kutch shawls: KHAMIR played key role in registration of Kutch shawl under the Geographical indications act. The 350 weavers of Kutch have organized themselves under the banner of a community based organization Kutch Weavers Association (KWA) to receive GI tag. 1.2 Water security for block printers: Looking at the issues of water quality and quantity in the block printing crafts, KHAMIR initiated a study of the overall water security of two key block print clusters. The interventions has been planned after intervention. 1.3 Credit support: KHAMIR initiated a research study with copper bell artisans to understand their livelihood related issues. Khamir initiated its credit and social security programmes. Under credit program, the artisans were linked with Pahal Micro-finance to avail short term micro loans. 1.4 Health and education initiatives: The health is a crucial issues with vulnerable artisan groups like lacquer artisans. Organization is working with them on hands on basis to provide quality services during their and health issues and emergencies. 1.5 Technological interventions: The copper coated bell craft of Kutch requires different technological attentions due to issues associated with it. The problems of occupations hazards, lead content into the bells, the design of kiln etc. have been studied. 1.6 Craft workshops and craft education: KHAMIR is conducting craft workshops to spread knowledge and skill of crafts among students, visitors, young designers and general masses. The workshops provide hands on experience to the craft practices while spreading awareness about the same. 2. General interventions across the crafts 2.1 Design interventions: The design interventions of KHAMIR are in the areas of textile and hard material crafts. The extensive interventions were carried out in the crafts like leather, lacquer, copper bell and pottery with an aim to diversify the current product ranges. 2.2 Value chain innovations in crafts: The initiative was started with recycling the plastic waste through weaving skills which was followed by interventions in the areas of Kala cotton. The Kala cotton is an indigenous variety of cotton which Khamir started converting into yarn. The yarn is given to weavers to weaving. The third initiative in this row is camel wool value chain, where Khamir is trying to create a range of beautiful products out of wool of Kachchhi camels. 2.3 Curated exhibitions: The first exhibition Textile legacies of Kachchh and Sindh was organized in year 2011-12. The textiles created by artisans of Kachchh and Sindh have been displayed with authentic information. Khamir organized a second exhibition on the theme of Bandhani of Kachchh: Ties across times in year 2012-13. Khamir is planning to hold an exhibition on block print and batik print crafts in year 2013-14.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: Center of Excellence Grant of Rs. 11.74 crore was awarded to Khamir in FY 2013-14 under Gujarat Industrial Policy 2009 - Scheme for improving Industrial Infrastructure for 3 years. sourceOfFunds.purpose: A street play on road safety was organized by the Commissioner of Transport, Gujarat State, Gandhinagar as well as RTO / ARTO in the rural Bavla area of ??Ahmedabad to reduce various accidents by artists of kosmos Creation Foundation Gandhinagar at various locations. Guidance was also given on how to wear a helmet while driving and how to install seatbelt. In which large number of people watched street plays.

THE PLAY DADA NE WHALO DIKRO WAS SUCCESSFULLY STAGED AT THE OLD AGE HOME BY A TEAM OF ACTORS THROUGH TRADITIONAL MEANS WITH THE HELP OF YOUTH SERVICE AND CULTURAL ACTIVITIES AND KOSMOS CREATION FOUNDATION GANDHINAGAR TRUST.

A PROGRAM OF TO KARO KANKUNA FULL LENTHA DRAMA WAS ORGANIZED IN SARGASAN VILLAGE IN COLLABORATION WITH GUJARAT STATE SANGEET NATAK AKADEMI AND KOSMOS CREATION FOUNDATION GANDHINAGAR. GUJARAT PRIDE AWARD WINNER AKHTAR SYED AND OTHER DIGNITARIES WERE PRESENT ON THE OCCASION. WELL KNOWN TV ACTORS SHRI BHARATSINH ZALA, HEMANT MISTRY, ASHISH GANDHI, ISHWAR PATEL, VIJAY DESAI, RUHIN GHORI, ASHA SADHU, DHIRAJ PURANI PLAYED THE PART IN THIS PLAY IN WHICH A LARGE NUMBER OF VILLAGERS WERE PRESENT.

IN COLLABORATION WITH DISTRICT INFORMATION OFFICE GANDHINAGAR AND KOSMOS CREATION FOUNDATION GANDHINAGAR TRUST, THE PLAY KHETI HAMARI PYARI WAS PERFORMED UNDER THE TRADITIONAL FESTIVAL, GIVING INFORMATION ABOUT AGRICULTURE AND SCHEMES TO THE FARMERS UNDER KRISHI MAHOTSAV.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: During the year 2015-16, Madhuvan Foundation has organized a blood donation camp,awareness programme on women empowerment at the Primary Girls School Bakrol,celebrated International Human Rights Day. we are working on volunteer bases for the creating awareness in grass root level.

During the year 2016-2017 Madhuvan Foundation organized snake awareness programme at the Mahavir Slum, Anand. celebrated the World Population Day,awareness programme on de addiction in the Rampura village and many other programmes we organised.

During the year 2017-2018 Madhuvan Foundation has distributed free note books to students who were belonging standards from one to four standard in the Makki School at Vallabh Vidhyanagara as dated on 3rd July, 2017. These books were distributed under our project Pasti Ki Pathshala With Ruddi Ka Ruaab.
